intro: Gibasis graminifolia, commonly known as the slender gibasis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
